definition: to pass entrance exam/to enter college after a competitive exam
to beat/to hit/variant of 考[kao3]/to inspect/to test/to take an exam
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: In 2007 Pan entered the School of Geography and Planning.
sentences.chinese: 2007年，潘文伟考入中大地理科学与规划学院。

sentences.english: He admitted his grandfather used to work at the university.
sentences.chinese: 他想考入他爷爷过去工作的那所大学。

sentences.english: After he was admitted to comply with the wishes of Beijing Union Medical College parents.
sentences.chinese: 后遵从父母意愿考入北京协和医科大学。

sentences.english: It is to hope to take an examination of Beijing philharmonic, 2 it is meet again of Chen Ya of become reconciled brother.
sentences.chinese: 一是希望考入北京交响乐团，二是和好兄弟陈亚重逢。

sentences.english: After graduation, was admitted to the Beijing eight.
Every fall hundreds of thousands of young people matriculate in colleges and universities.
sentences.chinese: 每年秋季成千上万的青年考入高等院校。

sentences.english: Although admitted to the two classes, but can not prove that learn English well.
sentences.chinese: 虽然考入了二级班，但并不能证明英语学得有很好。

sentences.english: Although they have been admitted to the high school, but their virtual rating not synchronization.
sentences.chinese: 尽管他们考入了高中，但是他们的实际能力并不同步。

sentences.english: The proportion of students entering universities and colleges is revving up in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近几年来考入大专院校的升学率正在不断提高。

sentences.english: My sister is enrolled in the Central Academy of Art to study western painting.
sentences.chinese: 姐姐考入中央美术学院学习西洋画。

sentences.english: She has been in the China Opera and Ballet Theater Troupe since 1997.
sentences.chinese: 年毕业后考入中国歌剧舞剧院至今。

sentences.english: Xiao Ming has been admitted by Shanghai University to study genetic engineering.
sentences.chinese: 小明考入了上海大学的遗传工程专业。

sentences.english: My dream is to enter Beijing University.
sentences.chinese: 我的梦想是考入北京大学。

sentences.english: In 1993, I got into the best high school in Wroclaw.
sentences.chinese: 1993年我考入弗罗茨瓦夫最好的高中。

sentences.english: Entrance to an elite college like Peking or Tsinghua University.
sentences.chinese: 考入类似北京大学或清华大学这样的精英大学。

sentences.english: Andrew is getting a lot heat from his parents to get into a good university.
sentences.chinese: 安德鲁的父母给他很大的压力，让他考入一个好大学。

definition: to gain entry by passing an exam/to be admitted to (a college etc)
to pass a university entrance exam
to pass an entrance exam/to be admitted to
Central Academy of Drama
pinyin: Zhong1 yang1 Xi4 ju4 Xue2 yuan4

definition: Shanghai Theatrical Institute
pinyin: Shang4 hai3 Xi4 ju4 Xue2 yuan4

definition: graduation/to graduate/to finish school
Beijing Film Academy
pinyin: Bei3 jing1 Dian4 ying3 Xue2 yuan4

definition: to go to school
to sign up for an examination/to apply for admission (to a university etc)/to apply (for a position)
to pursue one's studies
to major (in a field)/to study a specialty to obtain a higher degree
undergraduate course/undergraduate (attributive)
to attend (a school)/to drop out (of college etc)
to accept an applicant (prospective student, employee etc) who passes an entrance exam/to admit (a student)/to hire (a job candidate)
student of great ability
to enter oneself for an examination
